abstract: The steam-powered vehicle is the oldest known road-going original car in the world.
snippet: The steam-powered vehicle is the oldest known road-going original car in the world.
lead_paragraph: The world's oldest known running automobile sold at the RM Auction in Hershey, Pa., on Friday for $4.62 million (gavel price, $4.2 million). The steam-powered vehicle appreciated $1.12 million in four years, having been sold to a Texas collector, John O'Quinn, for $3.5 million in 2007 at Pebble Beach. The identity of the latest buyer was not identified by RM. Read more »

headline.main: 1884 De Dion-Bouton Sells at Hershey for $4.62 Million
